image.altText: A cream weatherboard building used as a medical centre.

props.synopsis: Next month, the retirement of a long-standing Tasmanian GP will lead to the closure of a small Tasmanian town's only clinic. More than 13,000 patients will be impacted, at a time when the pressure on the state's health system is arguably at its greatest.

title.children: 'Disruption and inconvenience' as another Tasmanian GP clinic prepares to close

image.altText: Teenage students solve maths problems in workbooks.

props.synopsis: One in three Australian school students are still not meeting literacy and numeracy benchmarks, and more than one in ten are so far behind they need additional support, the 2024 NAPLAN results show.

title.children: One in three students failing to meet English and maths standards, NAPLAN data shows

image.altText: A soldier wearing protective equipment rides a motorcycle

props.synopsis: Angry Russians displaced after Ukraine crossed the border and invaded the Kursk region last week have vented their frustrations online to President Vladimir Putin, as Kyiv says its forces are capturing more ground.

title.children: Kremlin could be 'nervous' as angry Russians send messages to Putin amid Ukraine counterattack

image.altText: Footy players jump in the air to catch the ball during a game, while a bet365 ad blinks from the stadium.

props.synopsis: The degree of trepidation with which the federal government is this week mincing around even the second-order question of banning gambling ads — just the ads! — gives you a very pungent sense of just how powerful this industry is.

title.children: Gambling ads don't fund our TV networks. We all know who really pays the cost

image.altText: A police car with police tape nearby.

props.synopsis: Police say the 46-year-old woman and the girl knew each other.

title.children: Police charge 46-year-old woman with murder after 10-year-old girl found dead on Gold Coast

image.altText: Photos of the underside of a Baby Maugean skates in a tank

props.synopsis: Scientists working to conserve the endangered Maugean skate are celebrating the first skate to hatch from an egg laid in captivity.

title.children: Scientists celebrate first Maugean skate hatchling born from a captive-laid egg

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie stands outside, looking serious.

props.synopsis: Australian Securities and Investments Commission chair Joe Longo appointed a chief executive to the corporate regulator without advertising the role, considering other candidates or consulting with other commissioners, documents obtained by the ABC show.

title.children: Corporate regulator faces questions over 'probity' of CEO appointment

image.altText: twitter pic reuters

props.synopsis: A network of 5,000 accounts apparently being operated using AI has been exposed on X, formerly Twitter, with concerns the Beijing-based operation could be designed to disrupt the coming US election.

title.children: Beijing-based AI network 'Green Cicada' exposed on X, with fears of plan to disrupt US election

image.altText: A render of a crowd in a stadium proposed for Hobart with blue lights

props.synopsis: This image shows what a concert could look look like at the proposed stadium, but one sceptic argues the appeal for international acts to tour Tasmania just isn't great enough.

title.children: New image shows concerts at proposed Hobart stadium, but former tour promoter says 'good luck'

image.altText: Watt is visible with a slight reflection inside of parliament house.

props.synopsis: The Greens and Coalition say they will not be railroaded into passing laws to allow a takeover of the CFMEU's construction division, as the government plans to force a vote on the issue.

title.children: Labor seeks to force vote on CFMEU laws 'warm from the photocopier'

image.altText: Ricky Maddison holds up a gun, seen through the windscreen of the police car.

props.synopsis: Six first responders to the fatal 2017 shooting of police officer Brett Forte have been commended for their bravery on that fateful day.

title.children: Six paramedics thought they were going to a car crash. Instead, they were met with gunfire

image.altText: Blake Wilson

props.synopsis: Nautilus Aviation said the employee held a New Zealand pilot's license but had never flown in Australia

title.children: Pilot killed in Cairns helicopter crash identified

image.altText: Orange scooters parked on a footpath in front of a bayside view.

props.synopsis: Melbourne's CBD has voted to cut ties with share hire e-scooter companies, citing concerns from local residents over safety.

title.children: 'It's shameful': Melbourne mayor vows to ban e-scooters in CBD within 30 days after council vote

image.altText: A man scans a QR code with his phone. Behind him, there is a cafe worker at a counter.

props.synopsis: Providing proof of age at the pub, details for checking in at a hotel, and qualifications when applying for a job, the government's proposed "Trust Exchange" system would allow Australians to do it all in a single tap with their phone.

title.children: A new digital ID is hoped to take the hassle out of renting, banking and visiting the pub

image.altText: A large crowd of people watching a band with their hands up in the air

props.synopsis: Bluesfest has been a hugely popular musical celebration every Easter for over 35 years. Next year it all comes to an end.

title.children: After 35 years, Bluesfest is coming to an end

image.altText: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi points at a reporter

props.synopsis: Former prime minister Paul Keating's comments on Taiwan draw international attention as former US speaker of the house Nancy Pelosi goes on the attack over his "Chinese real estate" remark.

title.children: As Pelosi attacks Keating's Taiwan comments, she says she would have hit Trump at US Capitol on January 6

image.altText: Linda Reynolds speaks at a doorstop as the PM Scott Morrison stands behind her grinning

props.synopsis: The defamation trial between WA senator Linda Reynolds and her ex-staffer Brittany Higgins hears from former Prime Minister Scott Morrison.

title.children: Scott Morrison says Linda Reynolds's 'lying cow' comment was 'out of character'

image.altText: Six police officers in a small boat patrol a remote swamp.

props.synopsis: The alleged leader of a gang behind a revenge attack that police say spiralled out of control, leading to a massacre and rapes, has turned himself in to the police, but his henchmen are still on the run.

title.children: PNG police hunting for gangsters in remote swamps after alleged ringleader of massacre hands himself in

image.altText: A man holding a huge wad of hundred dollar notes while giving a speech.

props.synopsis: The ABC has spoken to more than a dozen people who allege the lost their life savings after investing with Melbourne businessman Amit Miglani, who some accuse of leveraging trust to target members of Australia's Indian community.

title.children: Amit Miglani projected an image of success. His former investors say he's a 'conman'

image.altText: Generic picture of Australian bank notes

props.synopsis: The annual pace of wage growth has remained steady in the June quarter, at 4.1 per cent, with an increase in public sector wage growth offsetting a decline in private sector wages.

title.children: 'A little too strong for inflation': What recent wage price data tells us about future interest rate decisions

props.synopsis: Leading food manufacturers could soon be subject to mandatory health star ratings, more onerous labelling on packaged foods and restrictions on marketing, especially to infants, under a federal government overhaul.

title.children: Unsure if the food you buy is actually healthy? It could get clearer under government overhaul

image.altText: A pair of gloved hands clasp the hands of a child, which are covered in a rash.

props.synopsis: Jean Kaseya, head of the Africa Centres for Disease Control, said the declaration marked a "clarion call to action" for more proactive efforts against the disease.

title.children: Mpox declared public health emergency in Africa by top health body

image.altText: Transgender runner holding an Italian flag above their head

props.synopsis: Valentina Petrillo is set to become the first openly transgender athlete to participate in the Paralympic Games following the visually impaired sprinter's selection to represent Italy in the women's 200-metre and 400m races in Paris.

title.children: Italian sprinter set to become first transgender athlete to compete at Paralympics

image.altText: An aerial photo of flooded fields

props.synopsis: A coastal trough is expected to extend from Queensland to the NSW north coast on Tuesday evening and the SES is warning people to be prepared.

title.children: SES warns northern NSW to brace for more flooding, with record-breaking rains expected to continue

image.altText: Beau Lamarre in a police uniform

props.synopsis: It was the first time Beau Lamarre-Condon's case has been in court since police last month laid two fresh charges which now allege the murders were domestic violence-related.

title.children: Former police officer accused of murdering Sydney couple has charges replaced

image.altText: A young man with bandages at his home.

props.synopsis: John Hutchins lives with epidermolysis bullosa, a very rare and painful disease that results in sores and blisters on his skin. His family is taking part in a new documentary raising awareness about the disease, and is assisting the search to find a cure.

title.children: Man living with rare disease 'gives so many hope' in new documentary

image.altText: Ukrainian servicemen sit on tops of a military vehicle, realxing with one eating a packet of chips.

props.synopsis: Since launching a surprise attack last week, Moscow has been unable to push Ukrainian troops back after they advanced up to 30km into Russian territory and are now in control of about 28 settlements.

title.children: 'Embarrassing for Putin': Russian territory is under occupation for the first time since WWII

image.altText: Boy playing football

props.synopsis: Jayden Walmsley-Hume, 20, and his mother Katie Walmsley, 40, have been found guilty of seeking out and running down Taj Hart in their ute on a suburban south coast New South Wales street in February 2022.

title.children: Mother, son guilty of murdering teenager in 'revenge' hit-and-run

image.altText: Peta Murphy sits in a committee room inside Parliament House

props.synopsis: Peta Murphy's final political act was convincing those who sat opposite her in parliament of the need to tackle online gambling. But it's a message that looks to have fallen short with those who sat much closer on the government's frontbench.

title.children: It had rare bipartisan support thanks to a brave MP, but now Labor has put gambling reform on hold

image.altText: two black and white teen students with backpacks facing away from the camera, another sits behind a computer with their hand up.

props.synopsis: The latest NAPLAN report cards are in. Put your knowledge to the test with our quiz.

title.children: Are you smarter than a Year 9 student? Find out with our NAPLAN quiz

image.altText: St George Illawarra Dragons player Kyle Flanagan is alleged to have bit Canterbury Bulldogs player Stephen Crichton on the nose

props.synopsis: Kyle  Flanagan had said on several occasions during the hearing he "definitely did not bite Stephen Crichton", and also claimed he did not know a nose was in his mouth.

title.children: NRL judiciary hands Kyle Flanagan four-game ban after finding him guilty of biting Stephen Crichton

image.altText: Two men hold a firehose in front of a fire on shrubland.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of Greek firefighters are battling a wildfire that has now entered Athens and killed at least one person.

title.children: Europe's firefighters called to help battle Greek blaze as one person reported dead

image.altText: Nathaniel, Gareth and Stacey Train graphic black and white with aerial view of their property behind

props.synopsis: Three "radicalised" conspiracy theorists who gunned down two police officers and their neighbour believed they were in a "final battle" as "the end" arrived, a Queensland court has heard.

title.children: Extremism expert tells Wieambilla inquest the 'battle arrived' the moment the officers crossed 'the Rubicon'

image.altText: Elon Musk

props.synopsis: The site showed that the page was "not available" shortly after the scheduled start for some users.

title.children: Elon Musk claims 'massive DDOS attack' on X during Donald Trump interview

image.altText: A mural of a Bangladeshi woman with her head partially covered

props.synopsis: Hindus and Muslims came together in Bangladesh in nationwide protests for political reform. Now, old fissures are being reopened.

title.children: 'This country is not for us': Bangladesh's Hindus in fear as attacks and misinformation inflame tensions
